newsitem.title: ECUADOR: Two dead, 70 injured in Ecuador barracks explosion.
newsitem.headline: Two dead, 70 injured in Ecuador barracks explosion.

text.p: At least two people were killed and up to 70 injured in an explosion that rocked an Ecuadorean Army ammunition factory on the outskirts of the capital Quito on Tuesday, witnesses and medical sources said.
Dr. Jorge Andrade, director of a military hospital in Quito, said between 60 and 70 injured were admitted. A Reuter photographer saw two dead bodies being taken to a hospital.
The head of the army, Gen. Jorge Salinas, said the blast was an accident caused by a fire in an explosives store.
He said it would take military staff about three hours to clear the site and assess the extent of the damage.
Ecuadorean armed forces commander Gen. Paco Moncayo said the explosion occurred in Las Balvinas barracks, about 12 miles (20 km) from central Quito.
The injured people included soldiers and civilians, the photographer said.
